descr.p: This unit provides HTTP 1.1 protocol definitions, constants, and utility functions for web applications. It includes:

ul.li: HTTP header type definitions and string constants

descr.p: This enumeration defines all standard HTTP 1.1 headers as defined in RFC 2616, plus some commonly used non-standard headers like X-Requested-With, Cookie, and Set-Cookie.

element.name: THeader.hhAccept
element.short: Accept header - specifies acceptable response media types.

element.name: THeader.hhAcceptCharset
element.short: Accept-Charset header - specifies acceptable character encodings.

element.name: THeader.hhAcceptEncoding
element.short: Accept-Encoding header - specifies acceptable content encodings.

element.name: THeader.hhAcceptLanguage
element.short: Accept-Language header - specifies acceptable natural languages.

element.name: THeader.hhAcceptRanges
element.short: Accept-Ranges header - indicates server support for range requests.

element.name: THeader.hhAge
element.short: Age header - indicates response age in seconds.

element.name: THeader.hhAllow
element.short: Allow header - lists supported HTTP methods for resource.

element.name: THeader.hhAuthorization
element.short: Authorization header - contains client authentication credentials.

element.name: THeader.hhContentEncoding
element.short: Content-Encoding header - specifies content compression method.

element.name: THeader.hhContentLanguage
element.short: Content-Language header - specifies content natural language.

element.name: THeader.hhContentLength
element.short: Content-Length header - specifies content size in bytes.

element.name: THeader.hhContentLocation
element.short: Content-Location header - specifies alternative resource location.

element.name: THeader.hhContentMD5
element.short: Content-MD5 header - contains MD5 hash of content.

element.name: THeader.hhContentRange
element.short: Content-Range header - specifies partial content range.

element.name: THeader.hhContentType
element.short: Content-Type header - specifies media type of content.

element.name: THeader.hhDate
element.short: Date header - specifies message origination date and time.

element.name: THeader.hhETag
element.short: ETag header - provides entity tag for caching validation.

element.name: THeader.hhExpires
element.short: Expires header - specifies response expiration date and time.

element.name: THeader.hhExpect
element.short: Expect header - indicates expected server behaviors.

element.name: THeader.hhFrom
element.short: From header - contains user agent email address.

element.name: THeader.hhHost
element.short: Host header - specifies target host and port number.

element.name: THeader.hhIfMatch
element.short: If-Match header - makes request conditional on entity tag.

element.name: THeader.hhIfModifiedSince
element.short: If-Modified-Since header - makes request conditional on modification date.

element.name: THeader.hhIfNoneMatch
element.short: If-None-Match header - makes request conditional on entity tag mismatch.

element.name: THeader.hhIfRange
element.short: If-Range header - makes range request conditional on entity tag or date.

element.name: THeader.hhIfUnModifiedSince
element.short: If-Unmodified-Since header - makes request conditional on lack of modification.

element.name: THeader.hhLastModified
element.short: Last-Modified header - specifies resource last modification date.

element.name: THeader.hhLocation
element.short: Location header - specifies redirect or resource location.

element.name: THeader.hhMaxForwards
element.short: Max-Forwards header - limits number of proxy forwards.

element.name: THeader.hhProxyAuthenticate
element.short: Proxy-Authenticate header - specifies proxy authentication method.

element.name: THeader.hhProxyAuthorization
element.short: Proxy-Authorization header - contains proxy authentication credentials.

element.name: THeader.hhRange
element.short: Range header - specifies partial content ranges to retrieve.

element.name: THeader.hhReferer
element.short: Referer header - specifies referring page URI.

element.name: THeader.hhRetryAfter
element.short: Retry-After header - specifies delay before retry attempt.

element.name: THeader.hhServer
element.short: Server header - specifies server software information.

element.name: THeader.hhTE
element.short: TE header - specifies acceptable transfer encodings.

element.name: THeader.hhTrailer
element.short: Trailer header - specifies header fields in chunked encoding trailer.

element.name: THeader.hhTransferEncoding
element.short: Transfer-Encoding header - specifies message body encoding method.

element.name: THeader.hhUpgrade
element.short: Upgrade header - specifies protocol upgrade options.

element.name: THeader.hhUserAgent
element.short: User-Agent header - specifies client software information.

element.name: THeader.hhVary
element.short: Vary header - specifies headers affecting response selection.

element.name: THeader.hhVia
element.short: Via header - specifies intermediate proxy information.

element.name: THeader.hhWarning
element.short: Warning header - provides additional warning information.

element.name: THeader.hhWWWAuthenticate
element.short: WWW-Authenticate header - specifies server authentication method.

descr.p: A set type for working with multiple HTTP headers simultaneously.
Indicates whether a header is used in requests, responses, or both.

element.name: THeadersArray
element.short: Array of header name strings indexed by THeader.

descr.p: String constant for the 'Cookie' HTTP header used to send cookies from client to server.
String constant for the 'Set-Cookie' HTTP header used to send cookies from server to client.

element.name: HTTPDateFmt
element.short: Format string for HTTP date formatting.

descr.p: Format string used with FormatDateTime for creating HTTP-compliant date strings.

element.name: SCookieExpire
element.short: Format string for cookie expiration date.

element.name: SCookieDomain
element.short: Format string for cookie domain attribute.

element.name: SCookiePath
element.short: Format string for cookie path attribute.

element.name: HTTPMonths
element.short: Array of 3-letter month abbreviations for HTTP dates.

descr.p: Contains standard 3-letter month names (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.) used in HTTP date formatting.

element.name: HTTPDays
element.short: Array of 3-letter day abbreviations for HTTP dates.

descr.p: Contains standard 3-letter day names (Sun, Mon, Tue, etc.) used in HTTP date formatting.

element.name: HTTPHeaderDirections
element.short: Array defining which direction each header type is used in.

descr.p: Maps each THeader value to its allowed usage directions (request, response, or both). Used to validate proper header usage in HTTP communications.

element.name: HTTPHeaderNames
element.short: Array mapping header types to their string names.

descr.p: Contains the actual HTTP header name strings indexed by THeader enumeration values. Used internally by HeaderName function.

element.name: THTTPUnsafeChar
element.short: Type for representing unsafe characters in HTTP encoding.

descr.p: Byte type used to represent characters that need to be encoded in HTTP URLs.

element.name: THTTPUnsafeChars
element.short: Set of characters that are unsafe for HTTP URLs.

descr.p: Set of byte values representing characters that should be percent-encoded in HTTP URLs. Used with HTTPEncode to specify which characters to encode.

element.name: HeaderName
element.short: Returns the string name of an HTTP header.

descr.p: Converts a enumeration value to its corresponding HTTP header string.

element.name: HeaderName.AHeader
element.short: The header type to convert to string.

element.name: HeaderType
element.short: Returns the header type for a given header string.

descr.p: Converts an HTTP header string to its corresponding enumeration value. Returns hhUnknown if the header is not recognized.

element.name: HeaderType.Result
element.short: The header type, or hhUnknown if not recognized.

element.name: HeaderType.AHeader
element.short: The HTTP header name string to parse.

descr.p: Decodes percent-encoded characters (%XX) and optionally converts plus signs to spaces. The overloaded version without aPlusAsSpaces defaults to treating plus signs as spaces.

element.name: HTTPDecode.aPlusAsSpaces
element.short: Whether to convert plus signs to spaces.

element.name: HTTPEncode
element.short: Encodes strings for HTTP URL transmission.

descr.p: Converts unsafe characters to percent-encoded format (%XX). The overloaded version allows specifying custom unsafe characters and space handling behavior.

element.name: HTTPEncode.aUnsafeChars
element.short: Additional characters to treat as unsafe.

element.name: HTTPEncode.aSpacesAsPlus
element.short: Whether to encode spaces as plus signs.

element.name: IncludeHTTPPathDelimiter
element.short: Ensures a URL path ends with a forward slash.

descr.p: Adds a trailing forward slash to a path string if it doesn't already have one. Useful for normalizing directory paths in URLs.

element.name: IncludeHTTPPathDelimiter.Result
element.short: The path string with trailing slash.

element.name: ExcludeHTTPPathDelimiter
element.short: Removes trailing forward slash from a URL path.

descr.p: Removes the trailing forward slash from a path string if present. Useful for normalizing file paths in URLs.

element.name: ExcludeHTTPPathDelimiter.Result
element.short: The path string without trailing slash.

element.name: GetHTTPStatusText
element.short: Returns descriptive text for HTTP status codes.

descr.p: Converts numeric HTTP status codes (100-599) to their standard descriptive text. Supports all common HTTP status codes including informational, success, redirection, client error, and server error responses. Returns "Unknown status: XXX" for unrecognized codes.

element.name: GetHTTPStatusText.Result
element.short: The descriptive text for the status code.

element.name: ParseHTTPDateTime
element.short: Parses HTTP date/time strings to TDateTime.

descr.p: Converts HTTP-formatted date/time strings (as used in headers like Last-Modified, Expires) to Pascal TDateTime values. Handles various HTTP date formats and ignores day names and GMT suffix.

element.name: ParseHTTPDateTime.Result
element.short: The parsed date/time value, or 0 if invalid.

element.name: ParseHTTPDateTime.aTimestamp
element.short: The HTTP date/time string to parse.
